qas.question: What were new students once called by others?
What stipulation did the school base entrance on in 1945?

answers.text: applicant's father being British by birth

qas.question: For what reason as the 1945 entrance stipulation removed?
Who decided to remove the 1945 entrance stipulation?
In what year did A.J. Ayer become a Professor of Logic at Oxford's Wykeham?
In what year did Harold Macmillan become the British Prime Minister?
In what year did Eton remove the rule where a student's father had to be British by birth?
In what year did A.J. Ayer graduate from Eton?

context: In the past, people at Eton have occasionally been guilty of antisemitism. For a time, new admissions were called <a0_0>'Jews'<a0_0/> by their fellow Collegers. In <b4_0><b5_0><b6_0><b7_0>1945<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/>, the school introduced a nationality statute conditioning entry on the <a1_0>applicant's father being British by birth<a1_0/>. The statute was removed after the intervention of Prime Minister Harold Macmillan in the 1960s after it came to the attention of Oxford's Wykeham Professor of Logic, <a3_0>A. J. Ayer<a3_0/>, himself Jewish and an Old Etonian, who <a2_0>"suspected a whiff of anti-semitism"<a2_0/>.
